key_title: Key to the species of Zieria

breadcrumbs.key_title: Key to the main groups of plants in Victoria
Key to the families of Dicotyledons
Key to the genera of Rutaceae

source.author: Duretto, M.F.
source.title: Rutaceae
source.in_title: Flora of Victoria. Vol. 4. Cornaceae to Asteraceae
source.citation: From: Duretto, M.F. (1999). Rutaceae. In: Walsh, N.G.; Entwisle, T.J. (eds), Flora of Victoria. Vol. 4. Cornaceae to Asteraceae. Inkata Press, Melbourne.

leads.lead_text: Leaves densely hirsute on upper and lower surfaces
Leaves glabrous or glabrescent, at least on upper surface
Erect shrub to 3 m; leaflet margin flat to slightly recurved; inflorescence normally exceeding length of leaves
Spreading shrub to 1 m high; leaflet margin recurved to revolute; inflorescence usually not exceeding length of leaves
Terminal leaflet less than 15 mm long
Terminal leaflet greater than 15 mm long
Leaf margin usually flat, more or less crenulate; branches, leaves and sepals glandular-verrucose
Leaf margins recurved to revolute, smooth; leaves, stems and sepals not prominently glandular-verrucose
Leaves usually greater than 5 mm long and 3 mm wide, margins revolute; central Victoria
Leaves usually less than 5 mm long and less than 3 mm wide, margins slightly revolute; north-east Victoria
Branches, leaves and follicles glandular-verrucose; leaflet margins revolute
Leaves and follicles not glandular-verrucose, branches not or sometimes slightly verrucose; leaflet margins flat or slightly recurved
Stems usually scurfy to pubescent with stellate hairs, slightly ridged; widespread in wet forests
Stems glabrous, distinctly ridged; Grampians only
